Posts.Content: MRSROCKYTOP55 wrote: I have been away for a long time with issues from both spinal radiation and Tykerb.  Have not been able to sit up or even leave the house for other than Doctor or treatment.  This week CT revealed mets to lungs.  I will have a port placed and begin Navelbine once doctor has gotten approval.  Anyone have any tips or can tell me how long an infusion takes?  I have miss you girls but just did not have the strength.  Blessings all, Kathy Dx 11/17/2008, ILC, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx 9/24/2013, ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: On to Navelbine. Any help or suggestions? MRSROCKYTOP55 MRSROCKYTOP55

Posts.Content: MRSROCKYTOP55 wrote: Had my appointment with oncologist Thursday.  My pain is totally gone.  CA 15-3 up several points.  She moved me to on three weeks and off one.  I am so excited to get a week off now and then.  Then my husband reminded me that I may have Herceptin or Zometa on those off weeks.  Still ok as I get everything off one week in March!!!!!  She ordered new blood work, bone scan, and liver ultrasound, then return in two months.  All in all I am very pleased and happy for chemo break once a month.  Having a lot of nail issues and she put me on antifungals for that.   Any ideas why TMs up a little even though the pain is completely gone?  Blessings all Dx 11/17/2008, ILC, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx 9/24/2013, ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: On three, off one, YAHOOOOOOOOOO! MRSROCKYTOP55 MRSROCKYTOP55

Posts.Content: MRSROCKYTOP55 wrote: I am scheduled to receive by third AC treatment on April 6 and then would like to travel to the U.S.(I live in Costa Rica) I have been doing very well and have had minimal side effects.  I am seeing my chemo doctor on April 1 and am praying that she will say it is ok.  My father died two weeks ago and I was not able to travel at that time and would really love to see my family.  Any suggestions?  Kathy Dx 11/17/2008, ILC, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx 9/24/2013, ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Travel during chemotherapy MRSROCKYTOP55 MRSROCKYTOP55

Posts.Content: MRSROCKYTOP55 wrote: My oncologist has made a special request to get Tykerb approved.  I was started back on Herceptin and Tykerb will be added when approved.  I had progression of bone mets while on Taxol.  I had 21 Taxol and it is a little frightening to not be taking chemo.  She said there are other chemo options but they would like to reserve those for later if possible.  It will take about two weeks for approval to use Tykerb.  Anyone on this combo and how is it working for you.  Blessings, Kathy Dx 11/17/2008, ILC, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx 9/24/2013, ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx ILC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/6 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone on Herceptin, Tykerb and Zometa for bone mets? MRSROCKYTOP55 MRSROCKYTOP55
